intro: Quercus pedunculata var. typica, commonly known as the Chinese white oak, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, cupule-bearing acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
